title: Greek Honey Cake Recipe
description: This Greek honey cake recipe yields a very moist cake permeated with orange and lemon flavors. It is loaded with walnuts and soaked in a honey syrup.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Greek Greek Honey Cake 4.5 (141) 121 Reviews 25 Photos This Greek honey cake recipe yields a very moist cake, often found at Greek food festivals. Submitted by Jan O'Leary Merzlak Updated on March 5, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 (9-inch square) cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder 1 teaspoon grated orange zest ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon ¼ teaspoon salt 1 ¾ cups white sugar, divided ¾ cup unsalted butter 3 eggs ¼ cup milk 1 cup chopped walnuts 1 cup honey ¾ cup water 1 teaspoon lemon juice Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch square baking pan. Combine flour, baking powder, orange zest, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl; set aside. Beat 3/4 cup sugar and butter together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in flour mixture, alternating with milk, beating just until incorporated; stir in walnuts. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool cake while making honey syrup. Combine honey, remaining 1 cup sugar, and water in a saucepan; bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice; bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Cut cake into diamond shapes; poor honey syrup over cake. I Made It Print 163 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Greek Honey Cake 01 of 25 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 25 Photo by  debbie m 11/15/2024 Worth the effort I made this for a Greek dinner at a friends house. My husband and I took a little taste test and love it. Yummy and moist. In place of the water I used fresh orange juice in the syrup. Love the orange flavor. 03 of 25 Photo by  Marisa 10/16/2024 Love this! Waiting to enjoy!!!! 04 of 25 Photo by  Steve Smith 05/22/2022 Delicious and very easy to make 05 of 25 Photo by  Charlotte Speziale 01/31/2022 Delicious!! 06 of 25 Photo by  missdizzy80 09/18/2021 Made everything the same except these minor changes: used pecans (I forgot to buy walnuts), added good vanilla, halved the sugar for the cake, made the sugar syrup with OJ instead of lemon juice and added 1 small cinnamon bark. I split the cake to make 2 6-7 inch rounds and soaked the cake with just a few tablespoons of syrup (I do not enjoy very sweet desserts). Haven't tasted it yer but it looks amazing. Thank you ! 07 of 25 Photo by  Kathie 12/25/2020 Very nice! I read the reviews and decided to go with 1/4 of the sugar honey sauce. It was just right for us. Thanks for the delicious recipe! 08 of 25 Photo by  STP 09/19/2020 09 of 25 Photo by  need2act 08/24/2020 10 of 25 Photo by  Madams 03/18/2020 I used almond flour and no walnuts. I used about a 1/2 cup of the honey. It turned out very good with consistency of my mom’s halva recipe. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Melomakarona Cookies 2 Ratings Vasilopita - Greek New Years Cake 79 Ratings Finikia 14 Ratings Grecian Baklava 22 Ratings Chef John's Baklava 39 Ratings Baklava I 13 Ratings Yia Yia's Baklava 13 Ratings Kourabiedes 14 Ratings Pistachio Hazelnut Baklava 11 Ratings Baklava-Style Cheesecake Bars 1 Rating Greek Lemon Cake 222 Ratings Paximade 11 Ratings Serano Chocolate Cake 6 Ratings Vaselopita 8 Ratings Portokalopita (Greek Orange Phyllo Cake) 11 Ratings Galaktoboureko 89 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in flour mixture, alternating with milk, beating just until incorporated; stir in walnuts. Pour batter into the prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool cake while making honey syrup.;Combine honey, remaining 1 cup sugar, and water in a saucepan; bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice; bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes.;Cut cake into diamond shapes; poor honey syrup over cake.
